channel.title: How to fix java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 6
channel.description:
I need help fixing this, I just went through and changed stats on items. I also added a Nomad spawn. Then (for some reason) I compiled, and now I have this problem... I removed Nomad (Just to be sure he didn't cause it >_> ). Still have the problem...
The Whole Exception reads...
Exception in therad "main" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 6 at server.world.ItemHandler.loadItemList<ItemHandler.java:365> at server.world.ItemHandler.<init><ItemHandler.java:33> at server.Server.<clinit><Server.java:65>
Anyone help me? Please!

item.title: How to fix java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 6
item.dc:creator: @Encryptic Encryptic
item.description:
@Encryptic wrote:

Just replaced the Item.cfg with the original. Everything’s working again.
Thank you everyone for helping, if not for you I wouldv’e scrapped it and went on to another Client & Source!
Lol.

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 6
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

Davidi2:

You used spaces instead of tabs in your item definitions file I assume

Or perhaps he left out a value.

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 6
item.dc:creator: @Encryptic Encryptic
item.description:
@Encryptic wrote:

I’ll just replace the items CFG with the original.
Thank you everyone for your input!

item.title: How to fix java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 6
item.dc:creator: @PsychoScapeRSPS PsychoScapeRSPS
item.description:
@PsychoScapeRSPS wrote:

Either you used spaces instead of tabs or you misplaced a curly bracket { } <— one of those

item.title: How to fix java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 6
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Encryptic, post:3, topic:427041”]Is that a possibility?

–

I tried to search through all the items I edited and check for spaces, none of the items had Spaces, they had Tabs. :
Still having the problem though.[/quote]

Has to be. Just look at it.

at server.world.ItemHandler.loadItemList<ItemHandler.java:365>

Try using a backup of your item.cfg.

Read full topic
